body.para: Sorry about this, this is my fault. We pushed out a rush change to some language last week, and then I was out with a pulled back and not around to clean it up.
I'm going to be looking at sorting things out today.

That said, if you're currently using a key we issued for a Desktop app with Web style auth you can expect this be to deprecated, and then turned off at some point in the future. (though you'll get some warning)

quote.quotepara:
We've started getting tech support issues about a recent (we think) change to
the Flickr authentication page. The new text reads:
Important: You should have been sent here by Charles Wiltgen. If that doesn't match where you come from you may not want to authorize it to access your account.

The name in the first sentence is mine, and links to a non-existant URL.
Because users have never heard my name, and because the link is broken, it's
causing confusion and tech support issues.

How do I change the name from my name to the product name (Kinoma Play), and the
URL to <http://kinoma.com/>? We've spent all morning looking all possible
Flickr and Yahoo account information, and we're stymied. All of our Flickr and
Yahoo contacts no longer work for Yahoo. :^(
